sentences: Ja teil ei ole õigust deserteerida külla, kui teie koht on Tallinnas.
Ta tööst maha jätma oma kohused.
context: In Estonian, 'tööst' has two main meanings: 1) It's the elative singular form of 'töö' (work), meaning 'from work'. 2) It can also mean 'deserting' in military contexts, referring to abandoning one's post or duty. The word comes from the root 'töö' (work/duty) and is used when someone leaves their military service position without permission.
